results.title: The Percussions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Instruments of the band and orchestra”.
Explains that percussion instruments emphasise rhythm and provide special sound effects in marching bands, concert bands and orchestras. Includes demonstrations of the bass drum, snare drum, field drum, tympani, cymbals, tambourine, temple blocks, triangle, castanets, claves, gong, marimba, bells and chimes.

results.title: Introduction
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Instruments of the band and orchestra”.
Shows the three sections of a band - the brasses, the woodwinds, and the percussions - and explains the function of each group of instruments. Explains that the addition of a string section distinguishes an orchestra from a band. Includes demonstrations of well-known instruments from each section. Features the Jollet Township High School Band and the Youth Orchestra of Greater Chicago.
results.description:

results.title: The brasses
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Instruments of the band and orchestra”.
Explains the contribution of the brass section in bands and orchestras. Explains the principle of sound production in the brass instruments. Includes demonstrations of the trumpet, cornet, french horn, trombone, baritone and tuba.
results.description:

results.title: A Nana fish
results.creator_credit: Mullie Watson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Originally from Cherbourg, Mullie Watson tells of his fond memories of his nan, about the day they went fishing together and how an owl became his totem.

results.title: Adventures in the Strait
results.creator_credit: Sorogo Mills, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The rope that linked the dinghy to the boat had snapped. It was up to me to fix it. Sorogo’s story about an experience that showed him what he was really made of.

results.title: This is a story about the land we live on
results.creator_credit: Alisha Dark, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: This land has cared for our ancestors for generations and now it’s our turn to care for it. We need to take responsibility. This story is about Alisha’s personal connection with the land.

results.title: How to innovate
results.creator_credit: Janet Isaac, Bruce Moir and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Innovations”.
One of three films for use in the process of educating teachers about the nature and benefits of innovation in the school. Contains a series of trigger items or vignettes separated by blank film to allow the projector to be stopped for discussion purposes. It is essential that these films be previewed to assess suitability for the audience and to enable preparation for discussion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Janet Isaac, Bruce Moir and Film Australia
